programme.desc: A star in a nearby galaxy becomes unstable and releases a destructive burst of radiation in the direction of Earth. Sci-fi adventure, starring Brian Krause, Heather McComb, Najarra Townsend, Allura Lee, Alan Poe and Londale Theus

Overcome with curiosity, he pulls the weapon out only to awaken a monstrous creature carved out of solid rock that is part of an ancient curse connected to his ancestors. Horror, starring Chad Collins and Natalie Denise Sperl

programme.title: Star Trek

programme.title: Code Name: Geronimo (2012)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the 2011 American attack on Osama Bin Laden's compound in Pakistan, which resulted in the death of the terrorist leader. programme.title: Bloodline (2018)
programme.desc: A social worker who deals with abused teenagers struggles to keep his violent tendencies and need for justice in check. Psychological thriller, starring Seann William Scott

programme.title: Thir13en Ghosts (2001)
programme.desc: A family inherits an unusual glass house from an eccentric relative. The deceased was a ghost hunter, and created the house to contain the dangerous spirits he caught. When the ghosts are unleashed, the family must uncover the secrets of the bizarre house before it is too late. Horror remake, starring Matthew Lillard, Tony Shalhoub, Shannon Elizabeth and F Murray Abraham

Horror, starring Eva Birthistle, Stephen Campbell Moore, Jeremy Sheffield, Rachel Shelley and Hannah Tointon

Truly thinks Clegg is paying too high a tax, so he drags his friend to a council meeting. Auntie Wainwright has Smiler deliver a truck load of junk that the recipient did not order. Peter Sallis and Howard Fyfe star

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Lovestruck Truly learns his childhood sweetheart is to return from Australia - and eager to make a good impression, immediately sets about making sure the long-awaited expat receives an unforgettable welcome. Rural comedy, starring Frank Thornton and Bill Owen

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway: Private Investigators
programme.desc: Frank and Lu struggle to protect a troubled teenager suffering from nightmarish premonitions of murder. Starring Mark Benton and Jo Joyner

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway: Private Investigators
programme.desc: Things prove a little hot in the kitchen when the sleuthing duo look into a campaign of culinary sabotage. Mark Benton and Jo Joyner

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: In their first case without trusty colleague Jack, the team members reinvestigate the disappearance of PE teacher Jason Bowe when the remains of a body are discovered near the elite public boarding school where he taught. Unfortunately, their snooping could not have come at a worse time for the staff, who are preparing to welcome a local MP to open their new computer centre - but what they do glean tells them the dead man seemed very much a loner. However, it soon turns out he got on much better with his students, forming close and inappropriate relationships with several. But could his behaviour have rattled someone enough to kill him? Susannah Harker and Nicola Walker guest star

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: Katie unearths a disturbing secret that threatens to destroy her childhood memories when she returns to the house she grew up in. Richard is furious when Trudi declines an offer for her business from investor Chris Webb, while financial worries begin to take their toll on Jessica and Mark's relationship. Siobhan risks revealing her true feelings about Dominic's wedding after drinking too much at his stag party

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra reopens an investigation into the suspected suicide of a Foreign Office diplomat, whose body was found in a frozen London lake after she had suffered the personal tragedy of a miscarriage and the professional embarrassment of having a government laptop stolen from her home. The woman's fiance and twin sister both believe her death is connected to sensitive information held on the missing computer and blame her boss for her downfall - and when Sandra clashes with the man himself, it only makes her more determined to pursue the conspiracy theory, despite Strickland's advice to tread carefully. Simon Day and Sharon Small guest star

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The antiques dealer agrees to buy a 19th-century dresser for £65, and finds it is worth £20,000 - but unfortunately, he is not the only one who knows its true value and Beth is conned into parting with it. Ian McShane and Diane Parish star

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Cameron plans to give Chloe his mother's necklace as a Valentine's Day gift - but first he needs to get it back from Nicky. She has problems of her own - she's pawned Bernie's necklace to pay her mother's debts, but is still being harassed for more money, forcing her to put her life and career on the line. Sacha is troubled by a personal decision, but receives guidance from an old friend

programme.desc: With only a few weeks until their exams, the sixth form crew is determined to enjoy a good night out in Copa. Efan has no intentions of going, but Mali tries to persuade him to change his mind. Caitlin thinks that she is facing a night in with Sian, but things change when Cai decides to ask her what her plans are. Anest and Tammy haven't been seeing eye to eye, but hope a night out in Copa will do them the world of good

Stylist Helen Humphreys looks at how weddings changed during the 20th century while watching celebrations from Tiger Bay and Llanelli, Aberystwyth and Llanidloes

programme.desc: Stacey challenges members of the Paine family to declutter their home in seven days. In order to do this, they have to let go of half their possessions so that they can then reorganise their property. There are emotional moments as single mother Steph and her three daughters go through their most treasured items, and make some difficult decisions about what to let go of from their past. The items they do decide to let go of will be put into piles to recycle, donate or sell. Plus, tidying and upcycling tips from carpenter Robert Bent, organiser Dilly Carter and cleaner Iwan Carrington

Only the best cooks will remain to go on to the second challenge, creating a dish celebrating citrus. Hosted by John Torode and Gregg Wallace

programme.desc: In an episode recorded in autumn 2021 to mark the BBC's centenary, Jay Blades meets King Charles III, who was then the Prince of Wales, to explore their shared passion of preserving heritage craft skills. Jay, ceramics expert Kirsten Ramsay, horologist Steve Fletcher, and furniture restorer Will Kirk are invited to Dumfries House in Scotland to meet Charles and learn about The Prince's Foundation's work to train the next generation of craftspeople

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams venture through Canada's friendliest provinces - New Brunswick, Prince Edward Island and Nova Scotia, as they head to the seventh checkpoint in Liverpool, Nova Scotia. Zainib and Mobeen plan to test the friendly reputation of the area and rely on local hospitality to get them to their destination. Claudia and Kevin are running on fumes and are in desperate need of some good luck as they end up spending money to go backwards. Tricia and Cathie start to feel the stress of the race getting to them and put their efforts into rallying together for the final push and Monique and Ladi feel the pressure as the only team remaining to have not won a leg yet

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: In the Lake District, Gordon tasks the contenders to collect pine needles and cones from 40-foot trees to infuse into Michelin-starred Mille Feuille in a bid to demonstrate how they can turn humble ingredients into profit. Next, they create bottled sauces to sell at Hawkr Market in Gateshead, Tyne and Wear. It's a crowded market, so will anyone impress the secret industry greats Gordon has invited to the venue - and will anyone convince Sauce Shop enough to launch their brand as a 'special edition'?

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Bez, Motsi Mabuse, Shazia Mirza and Steve Pemberton join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The fourth quarter-final sees the week's most talented four cooks return to fight for a place in Knockout Week. They must cook two courses that will excite not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also 2020 champion Thomas Frake, 2010 champion Dhruv Baker and 2021 finalist Alexina Anatole. All three of their forerunners have gone on to forge careers in the food industry

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Gordon celebrates the very best of British - exquisite produce and the pinnacle of fine dining. First, he invites his entrepreneurs to the Fish Society in Surrey where he tasks them with perfectly de-shelling one of the most expensive foods to be found on any menu - lobster. He then puts the contenders in charge of his high-end Mayfair restaurant, Lucky Cat. With his reputation on the line and paying diners expecting immaculate food and service, he expects them to live up to his own extraordinarily high standards in order to have any hope of proceeding in the competition

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Telford, Shropshire, to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. Mayoral elections are also taking place in Bedford, Leicester, Mansfield and Middlesbrough. Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens and Professor John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. The BBC's Political Editor Chris Mason analyses what these elections mean for each political party, and senior politicians are on hand to give their verdict on the results

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: The newsreader travels around the country, immersing himself in Italian culture and sampling its renowned cuisine, beginning in the south-eastern region of Puglia. Clive discovers how the James Bond franchise helped turn an abandoned town into a world heritage site, finds out why Puglia is the gay holiday capital of Italy and learns to play in a traditional pizzica band

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Edith Bowman and Colin Murray explore the Foodies Festival in Glasgow, where they discover the secrets to the best egg fried rice with chef Jimmy Lee and how to spot fake vanilla. Chef Julie Lin digs deep to reveal some myths about frozen food and farmer Jim Smith learns the art of pickling, and discovers why one farm is turning its oats into milk

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: A mooring structure on the Isle of Wight ferries is in desperate need of repair, bringing the entire terminal to a standstill. The dive team arrive to repair the seaworn structure, working day and night to get the job done on time, but the task is made worse when they come across a mountain of discarded rubbish ranging from teacups to prams

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Sara Cox presents an appeal for Re-engage, a charity that provides life-enhancing social connections for the elderly to help them combat feelings of isolation and loneliness

programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: My Million Pound Menu
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix presents this new show which follows people who work in the food business as they seek major investment to launch their own restaurants. They have their concepts and branding - all they need now is the financial backing. First up is Epoch, comprising Manchester chef Ruth and sommelier Emily, who have an idea to pair British wines with the best seasonal produce. Meanwhile, Scotsman Ewen Hutchinson hopes to take his award-winning street food to the next level by opening his own establishment

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy narrates a documentary examining the lives of animals and people pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic, from the world's most powerful currents, ferocious hurricanes and huge chains of undersea volcanoes. The first episode looks at the influence of the Gulf Stream, with whales, giant turtles and jellyfish riding the huge current that becomes a migration super-highway and helps warm northern Europe, while fishermen battle for survival in mountainous seas as they try to exploit its natural fertility

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe presents a trio of sports-themed sewing challenges, including a Sewing Bee first - a pair of trainers, which includes unfamiliar techniques such as punching eyelets and stitching soles. That's followed by transforming an old netball kit into a garment to be worn off the court and a made-to-measure jacket inspired by their sporting hero

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Catherine Southon and Nick Hall assess items brought to Boconnoc House in Cornwall, and presenter Paul Martin participates in a traditional Cornish gig race

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Matt Edmondson, Sabrina Grant, Andy Hamilton and Kirsty Wark test their general knowledge in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Godfather fan Clive is in Sicily, where he visits the village that Francis Ford Coppola used to film a wedding in his classic movie The Godfather. He also joins geologists working on Mount Etna to predict its next eruption and heads to Modica to learn how to make a chocolate bar from an ancient recipe

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Mediterranean Adventure
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers get back on their bikes to explore the culinary delights of several Mediterranean countries, discovering hearty and healthy food from France, Spain and Italy. They begin by searching for the authentic flavours of Italy, from simple local ingredients to spicy nduja pate and some of the best gelato around

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace pays a visit to the Ambrosia factory in Lifton, Devon, to lift the lid on the 400g tin of rice pudding - one of the company's best sellers. He follows the process from the preparation of the rice and the blending of the milk to filling the cans, cooking and labelling - with up to 360,000 tins produced every day. Cherry Healey finds out about the millions of tons of rice grown in Italy's Po Valley every year and Ruth Goodman looks at the history of school dinners

programme.title: Highland Cops
programme.desc: Officers conduct a raid after they are tipped off about a Skye resident suspected of possessing an illegal weapon, while high winds cause a road traffic incident on Harris in which a car has flipped over several times. In Kirkwall, PC Simon Hay watches over the Horse March, an Orcadian tradition going back centuries that sees up to 100 horses and riders gather from across the island

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: Ash and Gordon's awkward sexual encounter causes them to drift apart. Comedy, starring Patrick Brammall and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Mark Urban

programme.title: Shadowlands (1993)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the later life of novelist CS Lewis, detailing how he fell in love with American poet Joy Gresham, only to see his new-found happiness marred by tragedy and illness. Directed by Richard Attenborough and starring Anthony Hopkins, Debra Winger, Edward Hardwicke, John Wood, Michael Denison and Joseph Mazzello

programme.title: Pilgrimage
programme.desc: Continuing their travels are actresses Su Pollard and Rita Simons, Shane Lynch of Boyzone fame, reality TV star Vicky Pattison, TV personality Bobby Seagull, comedian Nabil Abdulrashid and Paralympian skier Millie Knight. The pilgrims wake up in the village of Vitorino Dos Piaes in Northern Portugal, and decide to make a quick detour to The Sanctuary of Bom Jesus do Monte

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Nine home cooks take on the audition round in the second week of heats, hoping to impress John and Gregg who are blind taste-testing their dishes and picking the top three to fast track into the next round of the competition. The remaining six cooks face an invention test under the watchful eye of John and Gregg and two will be going home

He also joins geologists working on Mount Etna to predict its next eruption and heads to Modica to learn how to make a chocolate bar from an ancient recipe

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Weekly magazine for the deaf and hard of hearing. With voiceover

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Reg the Dalmatian is rushed in after eating a mystery object that has become stuck in his intestines. A scan shows the only way to get it out is to operate. Rupert the Cavalier King Charles Spaniel has an appointment in the Neurology department to get to the bottom of his headaches and Alexandria the cat is undergoing chemotherapy

programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: My Million Pound Menu
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix welcomes another two street-food brands to Manchester, where the owners pitch their businesses to high-street investors in the hope of opening their own restaurants. Up this week are Finca, a Cuban street-food brand whose founders Oli, Joe and Michael are looking to secure £150,000 to open in their home town of Liverpool. Meanwhile, former waitress Chelsea Campbell hopes to tap into the increasing number of adults eating less meat with her vegan junk-food idea Wholesome Junkies

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Documentary examining the animals pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic. In the vast South Atlantic, huge pods of dolphins, massive penguin colonies and the largest gathering of marine mammals on Earth pack chains of extraordinary islands, created by powerful volcanic forces far below them. Meanwhile, the nutrient-rich upwellings create profusions of life in some areas, and the abyssal depths host a world of bizarre creatures in others

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The competitors create light and airy outfits for the summer, beginning with a pattern for a high-fashion midi dress with puff sleeves, which involves the tricky task of sewing with elastic. The second task sees them transforming hammocks into summer garments, and finally they create a two-piece co-ordinated trousered outfit. Sara Pascoe follows their progress, while Patrick Grant and Esme Young decide the best and the worst

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Charles Hanson and Michael Baggott assess objects brought into the University of Nottingham, while presenter Paul Martin learns about a Nottingham-born Victorian prize-fighter called Bendigo and meets locals who are keeping his memory alive

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Matt Edmondson, Sabrina Grant, Andy Hamilton and Kirsty Wark test their general knowledge in a variety of trivia-based games across the week, with a winner declared each Friday

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive travels to the heart of Sicily to cook lunch in a community kitchen set up by Jamie Oliver's former restaurant manager and spends the night in a 700-year-old mansion. He also meets people from around the world who have bought homes in the one Euro house hub of Mussomeli and discovers arguably Italy's best street food in the island's capital Palermo

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Mediterranean Adventure
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the culinary delights of Sardinia, starting out in Cagliari, where everyone is in high spirits for the feast of St Efisio. The bikers join in by cooking a local speciality, almond and orange cakes. They also meet the tuna fishermen of Carloforte and a chef who has a special way of serving up platters of the fish, are shown how to make sheep's black pudding by a group of shepherds and are served a stew by the 'King of Sardinia'

programme.title: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: Banjo Beale makes over two spaces on the Isle of Mull, turning a Tobermory castle turret room into a B&B destination and revamping a guest bedroom at the Rubha nan Gall lighthouse. Contending with complicated logistics and bad weather, Banjo and the team must go above and beyond to complete two makeovers in these stunning locations

programme.title: Wales' Home of the Year
programme.desc: The search for Wales' Home of the Year 2022 continues in the South East with visits to a former nursing home in Pontypridd, a 1930s semi in Caerleon and a converted Borstal school outside Chepstow. The judges are led by drumming weatherman Owain Wyn Evans, with interior designer Mandy Watkins and architect Glen Thomas, who score the properties out of 10 on architectural merit, distinctive design and original style

programme.title: Coronation Tailors: Fit for a King
programme.desc: Menswear designer and Sewing Bee judge Patrick Grant takes viewers behind the scenes at uniform manufacturers Kashket & Partners as they pull out all the stops to prepare thousands of parade uniforms for King Charles' Coronation. The film reveals the rich heritage and history behind Britain's military uniforms and the stories of the men and women of the armed services who will wear them with pride

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Andy and Lance go to great lengths to protect their land, Andy quits his job and Lance finds an unwelcome guest in the spare room

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: David Harewood: Psychosis and Me
programme.desc: At the age of 23, David Harewood had a psychotic breakdown and was sectioned. Two years ago he opened up on Twitter about the experience - and now he wants to tell the full story. Travelling back to his home town of Birmingham, the actor lets viewers into the realities of experiencing a psychotic breakdown, and how much he blocked out at the time, meeting up with his mother and old friends who were with him at the time. But this isn't just his story. He also spends time with other young people living with psychosis and the NHS professionals who treat them

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Weekly magazine for the deaf and hard of hearing. With voiceover

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: It's all about innovation as Gordon invites the food and drink entrepreneurs to Oxford to replicate a sushi platter as demonstrated by a master of the craft. Who will listen and learn? He then asks them to embrace the world of cocktails and seltzers in a can, challenging them to come up with a brand that stands out on supermarket shelves. They launch their products at the world-famous Royal Henley Regatta, where undercover experts report back to Gordon on which ones are proving the most popular

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Cardiac surgeon Betsy Evans operates on her longest-waiting patient, Andy, who has a hereditary heart condition and needs an urgent triple bypass. A lack of intensive care beds for after-surgery means he has been waiting on the ward for four weeks and, as he also has bipolar disorder, every day spent waiting has been a challenge for his mental health. Professor Simon Kay aims to perform hand surgery on a teenage patient whose fingers are bent inwards, having been born with a rare and incurable joint condition called arthrogryposis

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The contestants face two challenges designed to gauge both their creativity and culinary repertoire. The first is set to a brief by leading food critic Jay Rayner, who asks that they put their finest dishes forward using a batter or dough. After that, they are challenged to serve up a dish featuring chocolate

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Presenter Christina Trevanion and experts Catherine Southon and Kate Bliss go antique hunting in Peterborough, Cambridgeshire, before heading to Lichfield in Staffordshire for today's auction. Christina discovers the history of the humble jigsaw and takes a closer look at a huge collection of puzzles

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive travels to the heart of Sicily to cook lunch in a community kitchen set up by Jamie Oliver's former restaurant manager and spends the night in a 700-year-old mansion. He also meets people from around the world who have bought homes in the one Euro house hub of Mussomeli and discovers arguably Italy's best street food in the island's capital Palermo

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara Cox is joined by comedian Sara Pascoe, comedy actor and writer Charlie Higson, singer-songwriter Katie Melua and actor and dancer Adam Garcia, who champion their favourite books. The guests also review this week's two book club choices, which are Strange Sally Diamond by Liz Nugent, and The Summer Book by Tove Jansson

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A homeowner makes an alarming discovery after hearing a bump in the night. A parrot owner is left spitting feathers when his beloved bird is stolen, and a doorbell camera solves the puzzle of a missing monkey-puzzle tree. Presented by Dominic Littlewood

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: My Million Pound Menu
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix welcomes another two food companies to Manchester, where the owners pitch their businesses to high-street investors in the hope of opening their own restaurants. Up this week are Hollings, which specialises in British chophouse classics, and the Cheese Wheel, an Italian-inspired brand serving fresh pasta direct from a cheese wheel

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Life in the tropical Atlantic, where everything from dolphins, manatees and whale sharks to sunbathing jellyfish thrive in the Caribbean's warm, sheltered waters, fringed by coral reefs and rich mangrove forests. But when extreme heat in Africa unleashes terrifying hurricanes, all hell breaks loose across the region

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The amateur sewers take part in reduce, reuse and recycle week, in which none of the fabric in the haberdashery is new. They begin by creating a quilted patchwork jacket with a load of old scraps from past Sewing Bees, then breathe new life into boring old coats by completely deconstructing them and reconstructing them into brand new stylish outerwear. In the made-to-measure challenge, the sewers must fit a maxi dress to a model using an unwanted duvet cover

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: David Harper and Adam Partridge search for items to sell at auction at Penrhyn Castle in north Wales. Paul Martin uncovers the story of Britain's longest-running industrial strike

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Matt Edmondson, Sabrina Grant, Andy Hamilton and Kirsty Wark test their general knowledge skills ahead of Friday's final. Richard Osman hosts

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: The newsreader explores the coastline around Mount Vesuvius, famous for the ruins of Pompeii. He unearths why volcanic soil makes for the tastiest fruit and vegetables, learns to make Italian marmalade, uncovers the surprising royal tale behind Italy's first trainline and tries his hand at carving jewellery from coral found deep beneath the sea

programme.title: Amol Rajan Interviews
programme.desc: Amol Rajan joins Richard Branson on one of his cruise ships in Miami to discuss his life, loves, passions and challenges. In a sometimes uncomfortable interview with rarely seen archive footage, Rajan delves into Branson's background to discover how he went from 1960s hippy to global business icon, re-shaping multiple industries and ending up in space

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Lochs
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores the lochs and mountains of Wester Ross and discovers that the loch-side communities were only finally connected by road in the 1970s. Paul borrows a bike and cycles over the infamous Bealach na Bà - one of Britain's highest and steepest mountain passes - before reliving the glory days of the Kishorn oil rig fabrication yard, which in the 1970s built the world's biggest movable structure

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: A mum thanks the fundraisers who helped her little girl to walk when doctors said that may never happen. And a man meets the woman who raised a life-changing guide dog. Alex Jones presents

programme.title: Guilt
programme.desc: On the run and out of luck in the Highlands, Max and Jake resort to desperate measures to hide from Maggie as they turn to their estranged father Alec for sanctuary, but Teddy pays a visit to Kenny and demands to know where the brothers are. With the Lynch family finances frozen, Maggie spots an opportunity in the sale of National Bank of Caledonia, much to Sir Jim Sturrock's surprise

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: Gareth is definitely going to be working from home today, in case anything unlucky happens, because it just happens to be Friday the 13th. Comedy drama written by and starring Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith, with Amanda Abbington and Samantha Spiro

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Nadiya: Anxiety and Me
programme.desc: Since Nadiya Hussain won The Great British Bake Off in 2015, she's rarely been off TV screens. But behind the scenes Nadiya suffers from extreme anxiety and debilitating panic attacks, which she's had since childhood. For decades, she has kept her anxiety a secret, ashamed to speak out. Now, she sets out to find the cause of her anxiety, exploring the most effective, available treatments, while also having therapy herself, in the hope of managing her anxiety

programme.title: Sus (2010)
programme.desc: A black man is taken in for questioning when his wife is found murdered on the night of the 1979 general election. He comes to realise that the police have already assumed he killed her, while the racist detectives interrogating him use increasingly brutal methods to force him into a false confession. Drama, with Clint Dyer, Ralph Brown, Rafe Spall and Anjela Lauren Smith

programme.title: Secrets of the Chippendales Murders
programme.desc: The NYPD investigates multiple leads regarding the murder of Nick De Noia, with possible motives including a love triangle, insurance fraud, or an angry boss - all of which lead nowhere. Years later, the FBI receives a tip from a hitman known as Strawberry, which blows the case wide open

programme.title: Secrets of the Chippendales Murders
programme.desc: The FBI teams up with down-and-out actor Ray Colon, who leads federal agents on an international manhunt for the person behind Nick De Noia's murder. However, even after the mystery is solved and the killer is behind bars, the story is far from over, with a shocking death and the discovery of tens of millions of dollars secretly hidden in Switzerland

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey through south-east Asia, learning how coffee was first brought to Java for cultivation, visiting the headquarters of the Dutch East Indies Railway Company, and ending at Surabaya, a port bursting with local traditions, produce and culture

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Robbie Cumming tackles the fast-flowing River Trent and is invited to join a night-time illuminated boat parade. However, his journey is hampered by a damaged wall in Worksop and a water shortage on the Chesterfield Canal which threatens his voyage

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel becomes suspicious of Alistair's overwhelming desire for his book to be a success. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Bob has doubts about his marriage when he realises all his peers - even the vicar - seem to be getting divorced. Classic comedy, starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam

programme.title: King Arthur's Britain: The Truth Unearthed
programme.desc: With access to a major new excavation on the Tintagel peninsula in Cornwall, Professor Alice Roberts pulls together the latest evidence to reveal what Dark Age Britain was really like. Long known to have been a Dark Ages settlement, the new evidence reveals that Tintagel was also a seat of power, and Alice explores the link between the location and Arthurian legend, tracking down the early sources for the period and the first written reference to King Arthur

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Detailed account of the bloody uprising at a New York State prison in 1971. Over 1,000 inmates took control of Attica Correctional Facility, seizing 39 hostages in the process. Their demands related mainly to the inhumane conditions they were forced to endure, but a huge police assault and a hail of gunfire killed 29 convicts and 10 innocents, an action that has left many survivors, both guards and inmates, seeking compensation

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc: Dr Helen Czerski tells the story of scientific endeavour, revealing the secrets of the universe as she takes to the skies in a jumbo jet, equipped with an infra-red telescope. She explores how the birds and the bees, who can see ultraviolet, view the world, and looks at how x-rays can be used to harness colours and image the human body as never before, thereby opening up new ways to treat disease

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey through south-east Asia, learning how coffee was first brought to Java for cultivation, visiting the headquarters of the Dutch East Indies Railway Company, and ending at Surabaya, a port bursting with local traditions, produce and culture

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Robbie Cumming tackles the fast-flowing River Trent and is invited to join a night-time illuminated boat parade. However, his journey is hampered by a damaged wall in Worksop and a water shortage on the Chesterfield Canal which threatens his voyage

programme.title: King Arthur's Britain: The Truth Unearthed
programme.desc: With access to a major new excavation on the Tintagel peninsula in Cornwall, Professor Alice Roberts pulls together the latest evidence to reveal what Dark Age Britain was really like. Long known to have been a Dark Ages settlement, the new evidence reveals that Tintagel was also a seat of power, and Alice explores the link between the location and Arthurian legend, tracking down the early sources for the period and the first written reference to King Arthur

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's 2,500-mile rail tour of south-east Asia reaches Malaysia. On the island of Penang, he traces the origins of the former British colony in Georgetown, rides one of the world's steepest funicular railways and is enchanted by exotic specimens at Malaysia's first butterfly sanctuary. Travelling on the nation's hi-tech railway network Michael visits its wettest town, Taiping, and learns how the discovery of tin made this land a prized possession for Britain. Next stop is the regal town of Kuala Kangsar, home to the Sultan of Perak and to one of Malaysia's most prestigious schools

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Autumnal fog and an overheating engine prove to be problems for narrowboater Robbie Cumming. As he navigates a Roman waterway, it proves to be a journey of many challenges as he runs aground and breaks down in Nottingham

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Days
programme.desc: Michael Palin sets out to find the Indian sailors who took him on a slow boat from Dubai to Mumbai 20 years ago during the filming of his first travelogue Around the World in 80 Days. During an intense week at sea in 1988, he and the film crew learned to admire and respect the underpaid deckhands of the dhow Al Shama in whose hands they had placed themselves, and their farewell was a memorably emotional occasion. The return visit offers a chance to see how the teeming city has developed in the Asian economic boom and discover whether the ancient sailing ship is still afloat

programme.title: Michael Palin's Quest for Artemisia
programme.desc: The Monty Python star sets off on a quest to investigate the story of little-known 17th-century Italian artist Artemisia Gentileschi after one of her paintings caught his eye. Michael encounters her work in Florence, Rome and Naples, and finds out about her life as a working mother and her ultimate success against all odds as a great painter of the Baroque age who transformed the way women were depicted in art, and who was sought after in many courts across Europe

programme.title: East of Ipswich
programme.desc: Seventeen-year-old Richard Burrill is dragged to the seaside by his parents where he meets Edwin, another teenager with strong views on life, and a Dutch girl with an eye for the boys. Nostalgic comedy, starring John Nettleton and written by Michael Palin

programme.title: Victoria & Albert: The Royal Wedding
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley oversees a restaging of the wedding of Queen Victoria and Prince Albert. Aided by food historian Annie Gray, clothing expert Harriet Waterhouse and military historian Jasdeep Singh, she recreates the most important elements of the ceremony and the celebrations, scouring history books, archives, newspapers and Victoria's diaries for the exact details of the couple's big day in 1840. Lucy also recounts the story of Victoria and Albert's courtship and engagement, exploring the hidden iconography and symbolism of this hugely significant wedding and revealing new insights into the pair's relationship, both public and private

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's 2,500-mile rail tour of south-east Asia reaches Malaysia. On the island of Penang, he traces the origins of the former British colony in Georgetown, rides one of the world's steepest funicular railways and is enchanted by exotic specimens at Malaysia's first butterfly sanctuary. Travelling on the nation's hi-tech railway network Michael visits its wettest town, Taiping, and learns how the discovery of tin made this land a prized possession for Britain. Next stop is the regal town of Kuala Kangsar, home to the Sultan of Perak and to one of Malaysia's most prestigious schools

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Autumnal fog and an overheating engine prove to be problems for narrowboater Robbie Cumming. As he navigates a Roman waterway, it proves to be a journey of many challenges as he runs aground and breaks down in Nottingham

programme.title: A Portrait of Carol Shields: Dressing Up for the Carnival
programme.desc: Documentary charting the distinguished career of the award-winning novelist and the long battle with cancer to which she succumbed in 2003 at the age of 68. Born in Chicago in 1957, Carol Shields settled in Canada and went on to raise five children and publish 16 novels, scooping the Pulitzer Prize for her book The Stone Diaries along the way. Interview footage with Carol, her daughters and a selection of her literary peers highlight the life of a gentle unassuming writer

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Days
programme.desc: Michael Palin sets out to find the Indian sailors who took him on a slow boat from Dubai to Mumbai 20 years ago during the filming of his first travelogue Around the World in 80 Days. During an intense week at sea in 1988, he and the film crew learned to admire and respect the underpaid deckhands of the dhow Al Shama in whose hands they had placed themselves, and their farewell was a memorably emotional occasion. The return visit offers a chance to see how the teeming city has developed in the Asian economic boom and discover whether the ancient sailing ship is still afloat

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: On the last leg of his journey across the North and the Midlands, Robbie faces issues with ice on the Grand Union Canal. He takes on Foxton's famous lock flight in Leicestershire and completes his journey in the picturesque village Braunston, Northamptonshire, regarded as the spiritual home for narrowboaters

programme.desc: Avid trainspotter Michael Palin fulfils a boyhood dream as he travels from Euston in London to Kyle of Lochalsh in Scotland. Part of The Golden Age of Steam season

programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: Chelcea's biggest passion is for hair! In this documentary, she shows us how she does her hair at home, doing her own hair, her mum's hair, her sister's hair, her friend's hair and even her dad's beard. Shemhas been doing lots of different hairstyles for everyone, inlcuding twists, braids (thick and small), plaits, tops buns, and also leaving it out as an afro, which is really good for the hair and scalp. Chelcea is an expert on the science of hair and how to look after it, and is particularity interested in natural hair remedies. Chelcea's parents encourage their daughter's passion and, through beautiful animation, we learn about her mum's childhood in the Democratic Republic of Congo. By taking us on her own hair journey, Chelcea's determination to inspire others to celebrate their amazing hair shines through!

programme.desc: The Squirrels have just got some new walkie-talkies and are having so much fun with them. Duggee calls the Squirrels to come for some blueberry juice, but as Tag is running, he trips over a car and falls through a secret door in the wall! Communicating through his walkie-talkie, Tag doesn't know where he is. He can see lots and lots of things around him, but no-one has any idea where this room is in the house. In Somalia, they have the traditional dish of nafaqo, which is boiled egg wrapped in mashed potato. This is what Zahra-Rose has chosen to make for her friends. To begin with, Zahra-Rose seasons mashed potato with salt, black pepper, flour, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder and fresh coriander. She then wraps the potato mixture around her special ingredient, hard-boiled eggs, rolls them in breadcrumbs and puts them in the oven to be cooked. Jay, ceramics expert Kirsten Ramsay, horologist Steve Fletcher, and furniture restorer Will Kirk are invited to Dumfries House in Scotland to meet Charles and learn about The Prince's Foundation's work to train the next generation of craftspeople

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams venture through Canada's friendliest provinces - New Brunswick, Prince Edward Island and Nova Scotia, as they head to the seventh checkpoint in Liverpool, Nova Scotia. Zainib and Mobeen plan to test the friendly reputation of the area and rely on local hospitality to get them to their destination. Claudia and Kevin are running on fumes and are in desperate need of some good luck as they end up spending money to go backwards. Tricia and Cathie start to feel the stress of the race getting to them and put their efforts into rallying together for the final push and Monique and Ladi feel the pressure as the only team remaining to have not won a leg yet

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: BBC Wales Live
programme.desc: Bethan Rhys Roberts presents the weekly show featuring stories and in-depth interviews about what is happening in Wales and why it matters

programme.title: Booksmart (2019)
programme.desc: On the eve of their high-school graduation, two academic superstars and best friends realise they should have worked less and played more. Determined not to fall short of their peers, the girls try to cram four years of fun into one night. Comedy directed by Olivia Wilde and starring Kaitlyn Dever, Beanie Feldstein and Jessica Williams

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: In the Lake District, Gordon tasks the contenders to collect pine needles and cones from 40-foot trees to infuse into Michelin-starred Mille Feuille in a bid to demonstrate how they can turn humble ingredients into profit. Next, they create bottled sauces to sell at Hawkr Market in Gateshead, Tyne and Wear. It's a crowded market, so will anyone impress the secret industry greats Gordon has invited to the venue - and will anyone convince Sauce Shop enough to launch their brand as a 'special edition'?

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Coronation fever sweeps across the square, Billy makes it his mission to convince Linda to host a party at The Vic and comes up with a way to include Mick in the celebrations. Reiss finds out why Sonia is fed up of him

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: Mum Sam thanks the fundraisers who helped her little girl Nova to walk and talk, after doctors warned that might never happen owing to her suffering an exceptionally rare condition. After losing his sight in 2018, Terry lost all hope for his future until guide dog Spencer came into his world. Terry is desperate to meet Maggie, who trained Spencer as a puppy, to let her know how the dog has changed everything for the better. Alex Jones presents

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Gordon celebrates the very best of British - exquisite produce and the pinnacle of fine dining. First, he invites his entrepreneurs to the Fish Society in Surrey where he tasks them with perfectly de-shelling one of the most expensive foods to be found on any menu - lobster. He then puts the contenders in charge of his high-end Mayfair restaurant, Lucky Cat. With his reputation on the line and paying diners expecting immaculate food and service, he expects them to live up to his own extraordinarily high standards in order to have any hope of proceeding in the competition

programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Telford, Shropshire, to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. Mayoral elections are also taking place in Bedford, Leicester, Mansfield and Middlesbrough. Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens and Professor John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. The BBC's Political Editor Chris Mason analyses what these elections mean for each political party, and senior politicians are on hand to give their verdict on the results

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey challenges members of the Paine family to declutter their home in seven days. In order to do this, they have to let go of half their possessions so that they can then reorganise their property. There are emotional moments as single mother Steph and her three daughters go through their most treasured items, and make some difficult decisions about what to let go of from their past. The items they do decide to let go of will be put into piles to recycle, donate or sell. Plus, tidying and upcycling tips from carpenter Robert Bent, organiser Dilly Carter and cleaner Iwan Carrington

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: In an episode recorded in autumn 2021 to mark the BBC's centenary, Jay Blades meets King Charles III, who was then the Prince of Wales, to explore their shared passion of preserving heritage craft skills. Jay, ceramics expert Kirsten Ramsay, horologist Steve Fletcher, and furniture restorer Will Kirk are invited to Dumfries House in Scotland to meet Charles and learn about The Prince's Foundation's work to train the next generation of craftspeople

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams venture through Canada's friendliest provinces - New Brunswick, Prince Edward Island and Nova Scotia, as they head to the seventh checkpoint in Liverpool, Nova Scotia. Zainib and Mobeen plan to test the friendly reputation of the area and rely on local hospitality to get them to their destination. Claudia and Kevin are running on fumes and are in desperate need of some good luck as they end up spending money to go backwards. Tricia and Cathie start to feel the stress of the race getting to them and put their efforts into rallying together for the final push and Monique and Ladi feel the pressure as the only team remaining to have not won a leg yet

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Janet Devlin: Young, Female and Addicted
programme.desc: Documentary following former X Factor star Janet Devlin, as she confronts her addiction to alcohol and meets other young women affected by problematic drinking. After shooting to fame at the age of 16, Janet became drawn into a strange world, where loneliness and social anxiety led to a downward spiral that was fuelled by alcohol and resulted in suicide attempts. It was only when she was introduced to Alcoholics Anonymous that Janet was able to turn her life around

programme.title: Booksmart (2019)
programme.desc: On the eve of their high-school graduation, two academic superstars and best friends realise they should have worked less and played more. Determined not to fall short of their peers, the girls try to cram four years of fun into one night. Comedy directed by Olivia Wilde and starring Kaitlyn Dever, Beanie Feldstein and Jessica Williams

programme.desc: Rav Wilding and YouTuber Jim Browning join forces with ethical hackers to hunt down cyber criminals. Using the same remote-access technology that criminals use to scam their victims, the team hacks the hackers and monitors their operation

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Bez, Motsi Mabuse, Shazia Mirza and Steve Pemberton join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The fourth quarter-final sees the week's most talented four cooks return to fight for a place in Knockout Week. They must cook two courses that will excite not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also 2020 champion Thomas Frake, 2010 champion Dhruv Baker and 2021 finalist Alexina Anatole. All three of their forerunners have gone on to forge careers in the food industry

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Gordon celebrates the very best of British - exquisite produce and the pinnacle of fine dining. First, he invites his entrepreneurs to the Fish Society in Surrey where he tasks them with perfectly de-shelling one of the most expensive foods to be found on any menu - lobster. He then puts the contenders in charge of his high-end Mayfair restaurant, Lucky Cat. With his reputation on the line and paying diners expecting immaculate food and service, he expects them to live up to his own extraordinarily high standards in order to have any hope of proceeding in the competition

programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. Mayoral elections are also taking place in Bedford, Leicester, Mansfield and Middlesbrough. Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens and Professor John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. The BBC's Political Editor Chris Mason analyses what these elections mean for each political party, and senior politicians are on hand to give their verdict on the results

programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: Bryce Larkin returns with news that Fulcrum has stolen a vital computer chip, which has fallen into the hands of well-to-do software magnate Von Hayes. Meanwhile, Lester faces a crisis when he starts work as assistant manager at Buy More

programme.desc: As the day of the prom arrives, there are repercussions from Nathan's pre-event party. programme.desc: Ryan and Taylor are involved in an accident while hanging festive lights and find themselves transported to a parallel universe, where they are forced to find a way of putting things right again

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian hosts a revival of classic game show Take Your Pick, with a selection of plucky audience members going up against the gong and play the famous Yes/No game. programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: Sarah unexpectedly bumps into Heather Chandler, a girl who made her teenage years miserable. The pair recall their younger days, but Chuck notices something unusual about Heather's husband Mark - and discovers there may be a sinister reason why their paths have crossed. Meanwhile, Lester's new sales tactics cause havoc at Buy More. Guest starring Nicole Richie (The Simple Life) and Ben Savage (Boy Meets World)

programme.title: One Tree Hill
programme.desc: Peyton is left to face the serious consequences of her decision to stay away from the prom, and Lucas makes a discovery about his uncle's death. Dan continues his attempts to win over Karen, while Nathan and Haley look forward to spending the night romancing

programme.desc: Ant and Dec host as memorable campmates from past series of I'm A Celebrity...Get Me Out Of Here! compete against one another in the South African jungle

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: The employees are all struck down with food poisoning, although Amy suspects her sickness might be for other reasons. Meanwhile, Glenn has a bad trip to the pharmacy

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: The employees have a clean out to start the new year. Meanwhile, Cheyenne proves untrustworthy and Amy discovers she has walked away with big money

programme.title: Bob's Burgers
programme.desc: The kids feel guilty when the restaurant catches fire the night before Oceanfest, an important sales day for Bob's Burgers

programme.title: Bob's Burgers
programme.desc: When Gene gets food poisoning on Thanksgiving day, Bob, Tina, and Louise tell him food-based stories that are based on famous movies to help him feel better

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The competition gets fierce when the final 10 chefs compete for a grand advantage at HK Carne-Val, as one chef from each team goes head to head in different carnival games

programme.title: Plebs
programme.desc: The boys gatecrash a posh banquet having received an invitation by mistake. Once there, Marcus attempts to win favour with their host Senator Varus, while Jason seduces bored aristocrat Rufina. Banished to eat with the other slaves, Grumio overhears what he thinks might be a poison plot. Guest starring Amanda Holden, Tracy-Ann Oberman and David Calder

programme.title: Plebs
programme.desc: There's a heatwave in Rome and Marcus has invested in an exciting new gimmick for the bar - ice. Grumio develops an innovation of his own in the form of a hat-parasol hybrid, which attracts the attention of wealthy entrepreneur Severus. Jason and Aurelius both join male escort agency the Knights of Eros

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter becomes the president of a cigarette company that uses toy products to promote smoking among children. Lois initially urges him to take a stand against the policy - but the perks of his new job soon persuade her to drop her opposition

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg becomes a getaway driver, while Quagmire is unable to cure his hiccups and asks Peter to kill him

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan deals with childhood issues of abandonment, and Klaus starts a website to embarrass the Smith family about their failures

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Roger is offended by the family during his birthday celebrations, and vows to turn his life around - and take revenge. However, the alien takes things a step too far, causing the family to go on the run

programme.title: Bob's Burgers

He also reveals what we can do to get more for our money, recreating some of the nation's top 10 ready meals with his own hacks on how to make your own versions of the classics for less. programme.title: Dark Water: The Murder of Shani Warren
programme.desc: Twenty-six-year-old Shani Warren was found drowned in Taplow Lake, Buckinghamshire, with her hands tied and feet bound together in 1987, with the case becoming known as that of 'the Lady in the Lake'. After years of investigation that failed to find the killer, police drew a blank, leaving the family to endure many frustrating years. Then, in 2020, a forensic breakthrough by the Thames Valley Police cold case team finally revealed the terrible truth about what had happened

Junior doctor Ashleigh Trimble assesses 70-year-old Dave, whose daughter Sarah fears her dad's confusion and loss of appetite are masking a more serious condition

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc: PCs Matt Turner and Rich Woodward are on the tail of an uninsured vehicle. When they finally catch up to the vehicle and question the suspect, they're surprised to discover the driver has never taken a driving test. On the M6, Inspector Anton Sullivan is responding to a collision between a car and an HGV. As the HGV has stopped on a live lane, Anton is tasked with trying to stop traffic, across six busy lanes, while in an unmarked police vehicle

programme.title: Building Britain's Canals
programme.desc: Dan Jones examines Britain's most iconic canals, beginning with the 152-mile Grand Union Canal, which runs up the spine of the country. Constructed at the height of the Industrial Revolution, the task challenged even the greatest engineering minds of the time, including pioneers such as James Brindley, the man behind Britain's first commercial canal, and William Jessop, the person with whom responsibility lay for the building of the main link from Birmingham to London. Travelling along its route, Dan experiences first-hand the innovations behind its construction, including the Blisworth tunnel

programme.desc: Michael heads for his final stretch in Cornwall, and takes in a coastline of hidden coves, a stunning sub-tropical garden and smugglers' creeks, immortalised by Daphne du Maurier in her novel Frenchman's Creek. Drama, starring Bertie Carvel

programme.title: Killer at the Crime Scene
programme.desc: After a brutally murdered oil rig worker is found in a burnt-out car, a quiet Scottish town soon becomes inflamed with rumours and fear

programme.title: Cause of Death: The Coroner's Office
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of senior coroner for Lancashire and Darwen Dr James Adeley, who runs a team that works from the moment a body arrives in the mortuary through to the inquest, when the cause of death is determined. In the early hours of the morning, two elderly men are found semi-conscious with head injuries in the middle of a darkened stretch of road in Leyland, Lancashire. Police escalate their transfer to Preston Royal Hospital, but one of the men's conditions worsens and he dies. The surviving man has no memory of events, so it is up to the coroner to establish what happened that night, and determine the cause of death

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: In Huddersfield, officers are in pursuit of a van driver who smashed his van into a parked car before fleeing, while Bob and Dan pepper spray a suspect who is not keen on being handcuffed. Chris and Chris go after a stolen car whose driver gets too close to some railings, and the Operational Support Unit deal with a suspected heroin user carrying a number of bank cards and needles

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Secret Scotland with Susan Calman
programme.desc: The comedian traverses the North Coast 500, a 500-mile trip around the northernmost parts of mainland Britain. Beginning in the village of Golspie, Susan travels round the coast to Dunrobin Castle. There, she sees the 189-room property's clock tower inspired by Big Ben, as well as its very own private train station. Further up the coast, Susan visits the Whaligoe steps, stunningly carved into the dramatic landscape, before getting a taste of the work of a real-life 'herring girl'. After stopping off at John O' Groats, the presenter heads to Dunnet Head for a spot of puffin-watching

programme.title: The Funny Thing About
programme.desc: Johnny Vegas presents a whistle-stop tour of awkward, embarrassing and cringeworthy holiday moments, as related by a selection of comedians and celebrities. Johnny's famous contributors skewer the traditional staycation, questioning the perks of rain-drenched British beaches, and whether anyone really likes going camping. Turning their attention further afield, the stars share some of their most memorable holiday tales, including transforming a hotel corridor into one long 'slip-and-slide', the suspicious discovery of a pair of chicken fillets in a swimming pool in Marbella, and a blush-inducing incident involving a naked paragliding session along a Spanish beachfront

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel and Joey struggle to find the words to tell Ross about their kiss in Barbados, while Phoebe makes the alarming discovery that Mike has a girlfriend. Starring Jennifer Aniston, Matt LeBlanc and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice and presenter Alistair Appleton offer advice to the owner of a loft apartment in Manchester. Although it is situated in a highly desirable area, the property is full of clutter and no one is prepared to offer the £115,000 asking price

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Pip and Posy

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Chicaletta goes missing on Chicken Day and the PAW Patrol has to find her to save the festivities

programme.title: Samson and Delilah (1949)
programme.desc: Hebrew warrior Samson becomes a wanted man after crossing paths with Philistine troops, but he constantly thwarts their efforts to capture him using to his incredible strength. Determined to bring him down, the Saran of Gaza makes use of his beguiling sister Delilah, who seduces Samson and manages to rob him of the source of his power. Cecil B DeMille's Oscar-winning adaptation of the biblical tale, starring Victor Mature, Hedy Lamarr, George Sanders, Angela Lansbury and Henry Wilcox

programme.title: The Last Hurrah (1958)
programme.desc: John Ford's political drama, starring Spencer Tracy as a headstrong New England mayor who launches one final re-election campaign. However, he finds the nature of politics is changing and that he has a powerful enemy in a wealthy and influential local banker (Basil Rathbone). Also starring Jeffrey Hunter and Pat O'Brien

programme.title: Young Winston (1972)
programme.desc: Biopic of Winston Churchill, following the future prime minister's formative years. While working as a journalist, he travels to Africa to report on the Boer Wars, an assignment that leads to his incarceration in a prison camp. He escapes from captivity and returns to England to begin a political career. Directed by Richard Attenborough and starring Simon Ward, Anthony Hopkins, Anne Bancroft and Robert Shaw

programme.title: Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country (1991)
programme.desc: Captain Kirk is framed for the assassination of the Klingon head of state just as the Federation is about to make peace with their old enemies. As Kirk and Dr McCoy are banished to an icy prison planet, Spock tries to uncover the identity of the real killers. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy, DeForest Kelley, Christopher Plummer, with appearances by Christian Slater and Michael Dorn from Star Trek: The Next Generation

programme.title: 12 Strong (2018)
programme.desc: The story of the first Special Forces team deployed to Afghanistan after 9/11. Under the leadership of a new captain, the team must work with an Afghan warlord to take down the Taliban. War drama, based on Doug Stanton's non-fiction book Horse Soldiers, starring Chris Hemsworth, Michael Shannon and Michael Pena

programme.title: Dreamland (2020)
programme.desc: During the Great Depression, Eugene Evans dreams of escaping his small Texas town when he discovers a wounded, fugitive bank robber. Torn between claiming the bounty for her capture and his growing attraction to the seductive criminal, Eugene must make a decision that will affect the lives of everyone he's ever loved. Romantic drama, starring Finn Cole and Margot Robbie

programme.title: Battle of the Sexes (2017)
programme.desc: Women's tennis champion Billie Jean King takes up the challenge to face former men's champ Bobby Riggs on the court, and disprove his claims that the women's game is an inferior sport. As the match develops into a media circus, both players face problems of their own, as King comes to terms with her sexuality and Riggs battles his gambling addiction. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Emma Stone and Steve Carell

programme.title: The Bedford Incident (1965)
programme.desc: The ruthless captain of a US destroyer develops an obsession with tracking down a Russian submarine. As he drives his men harder, he fails to anticipate the consequences of his actions - leading to a fatal mistake. Cold War thriller, starring Richard Widmark, Sidney Poitier, Martin Balsam, Wally Cox, Eric Portman and Donald Sutherland

programme.title: Arabian Nights (1942)
programme.desc: The story of two half-brothers - one the heroic caliph, the other an evil usurper - as they do battle for the right to rule their kingdom, and win the hand of beautiful dancer Sherazade. Adaptation of the classic adventure tales, starring Jon Hall, Maria Montez, Sabu and Leif Erickson

programme.title: Red Mountain (1951)
programme.desc: A Confederate captain sets out to join forces with notorious guerilla militia Quantrill's Raiders, but stops off en route to rescue a man from being lynched for a murder he himself committed - and complicates matters by falling for his fiancee. Western set during the American Civil War, starring Alan Ladd and Lizabeth Scott

programme.title: 23 Paces to Baker Street (1956)
programme.desc: A blind playwright overhears a conversation in a London pub concerning a kidnapped child. He goes straight to the police, but they dismiss his story as the product of an overactive imagination, forcing him to take matters into his own hands. With the help of his fiancee and secretary, he sets out to rescue the child and catch the crooks - but his only clue is the scent of a distinctive perfume. Thriller, with Van Johnson, Cecil Parker, Patricia Laffan and Vera Miles

programme.title: Tucker: The Man and His Dream (1988)
programme.desc: The story of inventor Preston Tucker, who pioneered a range of futuristic automobiles in the post-war years, only to have his dreams hampered by corporate self-interest before the cars even rolled out of the garage. Drama, starring Jeff Bridges, Joan Allen and Christian Slater

programme.title: Men in Black: International (2019)
programme.desc: The intergalactic law enforcers have always protected the Earth from the scum of the universe. This time they tackle their biggest threat - a mole in the Men in Black organisation. Director F Gary Gray's fantasy sequel, starring Chris Hemsworth, Tessa Thompson and Rebecca Ferguson

programme.title: I'm Your Man (2021)
programme.desc: To obtain research funds for her studies, a scientist accepts an offer to live with a humanoid robot, created to make her happy. Comedy drama, starring Maren Eggert and Dan Stevens. In German with English subtitles

programme.title: Life Is Sweet (1990)
programme.desc: A suburban chef makes an ill-advised attempt to launch his own fast food business, while his wife is drawn into a socially awkward friend's plans to open a bizarre restaurant. Their twin daughters lead very different lives, one optimistically dreaming of foreign travel, the other concealing an eating disorder. Mike Leigh's comedy drama, starring Alison Steadman, Jim Broadbent, Jane Horrocks, Timothy Spall, Claire Skinner and Stephen Rea

programme.title: Yangtse Incident (1957)
programme.desc: A British frigate is heavily shelled and captured by Chinese communists on the Yangtse River in 1949. After a failed rescue mission by a sister ship, the remaining crew members put into action a daring escape plan that involves disguising the vessel and slipping her moorings under the cover of darkness. Fact-based action adventure, starring Richard Todd, William Hartnell and Akim Tamiroff

programme.title: The Far Country (1954)
programme.desc: A cowpoke is steering his cattle north to the Canadian border when a corrupt sheriff commandeers the herd. A local saloon-bar owner falls for the hapless cowboy, and with her help he recaptures his cattle. Hooking up with a wagon train, the couple head for the mining town of Dawson, but the thwarted and embittered sheriff is on their tail. Western, with James Stewart, Walter Brennan and Ruth Roman

programme.title: 12 Angry Men (1957)
programme.desc: Twelve jurors convene to decide the verdict in a murder trial. While 11 of the group are thoroughly convinced the teenage defendant is guilty, one lone voice of reason refuses to cave in to pressure and passionately argues the case for his innocence. Sidney Lumet's legal drama, starring Henry Fonda, Lee J Cobb, Ed Begley, Martin Balsam and Jack Klugman

programme.title: Dad's Army (1971)
programme.desc: The ragtag soldiers of the Walmington-on-Sea Home Guard are given the chance to prove their mettle by apprehending three German aviators who have parachuted into the country in the vanguard of a suspected Nazi invasion. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Arthur Lowe, John Le Mesurier, Clive Dunn, Bill Pertwee, Ian Lavender and Arnold Ridley

programme.title: Gifted (2017)
programme.desc: Single man Frank Adler attempts to raise his child prodigy niece, Mary. However, his plans for a normal school life for the youngster are foiled when the youngster's mathematical abilities come to the attention of Frank's formidable mother, Evelyn. Drama, starring Chris Evans, Lindsay Duncan and Mckenna Grace

programme.title: Bohemian Rhapsody (2018)
programme.desc: Freddie Mercury and Queen go from playing small venues to becoming one of the biggest rock bands in the world. While Freddie comes to terms with his sexuality, outside forces threaten to tear the group apart, until their defining moment at Live Aid in July 1985. Oscar-winning biopic, starring Rami Malek, Lucy Boynton and Gwilym Lee

programme.title: Darkman (1990)
programme.desc: A scientist working on synthetic skin is horribly disfigured and left for dead by a criminal gang. Now unable to feel pain, he continues his research, creating artificial faces that will last for only a short time. He uses these disguises to aid him in taking revenge on those who mutilated him - while also using a mask of his own face to see the girlfriend who thinks he died. Thriller, starring Liam Neeson and Frances McDormand

programme.title: Slaughterhouse Rulez (2018)
programme.desc: A British boarding school becomes a blood-soaked battleground when a strange sinkhole appears at a nearby fracking site, unleashing all manner of horrors for a reluctant new pupil and his associates. Comedy horror co-written and directed by Crispian Mills, former frontman with Kula Shaker, starring Asa Butterfield, Simon Pegg and Margot Robbie

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: The McQueen family scramble to pull together whatever money they can. Cindy's curiosity is sparked when she sees Alex sniffing around the Grand Bazaar

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef again comes to the aid of failing American restaurants, starting in Fishtown, Philadelphia, where he tries to help the three owners of the Hot Potato Cafe, which has not made a profit in two years. Spurred on by a scathing review by an influential critic, he makes radical changes to alter the staff's attitudes and create food that is up to his own exacting standards

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitchell throws Lily a party to celebrate her second birthday and invites his mother DeDe - who creates tension by bringing along Claire's former lover Robbie. Guest starring Shelley Long (Cheers) and Matt Dillon (Crash)

programme.desc: Jeffords wants to file an official complaint against a fellow police officer who stops him in his own neighbourhood while he is off duty, but Captain Holt has other ideas. Peralta and Santiago glimpse the difficulties of parenthood when they babysit for Jeffords' children

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The squad members head to the annual Tri-State Cop-Con event, which is usually their excuse for a big party. However, their fun is threatened when Captain Holt asks them to be on their best behaviour.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard is torn between his relationship with Bernadette and pleasing his mother - and comes up with a solution that leaves everyone unsatisfied. Leonard rekindles his romance with Raj's sister Priya, while Amy uses Penny's emotions as the basis for a research project

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon decides to make a new set of friends as he is depressed that the group's social world revolves around Leonard rather than himself. Meanwhile, Amy and Bernadette try to persuade Penny to go on a date. Comedy, guest starring LeVar Burton, with Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Mayim Bialik

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy has a meltdown when she feels the pressure of what it would mean for women everywhere if she were to win a Nobel Prize. Raj and Howard attempt to relive the good old days when Howard buys a scooter that looks like the one he had years earller

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj is worried that people won't take him seriously in his own field after publishing a paper that suggests he may have discovered alien life. Penny encourages Leonard to stand up for himself when he aims to become the principal investigator on a plasma physics study

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay hopes for a quiet afternoon on the lake fishing, but his family has other plans involving fuss and thrills. Claire and Mitchell become trapped in their childhood home, Phil meets his arch-enemy from college at a shopping centre and Cam encounters a sticky situation at the bakery. Meanwhile, the children face the task of creatively editing their grandfather's birthday video

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The calamity-prone group visits a guest ranch where Mitch and Cam hope to rediscover their macho side, and a cowboy named Hank takes an instant shine to Gloria. Comedy, starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The precinct embarks on its fifth annual Halloween Heist and, as usual, everybody has a plan and no one is safe. Relationships and friendships are tested in the competition to win a spectacular championship belt and the title 'Amazing Human Slash Genius' by midnight, leaving all the members of the squad pitted against one another

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: To track down an infamous arms dealer, Peralta and Jeffords go undercover at an illegal gambling club, but when Captain Holt tries to coach them in the art of poker, his addiction resurfaces. Boyle buys a food truck that was formerly the site of a brutal double murder, to the horror of his only investor in the project, Santiago. Hitchcock and Scully have an unusual challenge for Dia. Cop comedy, starring Andy Samberg

Other surgeons must perform a complex procedure to try to save a photographer's arm, and remove new cancer growth in a patient's abdomen
