programme.desc: Paramedics treat a man who has injured himself while wheeling a push bike home. Cameras also focus on a woman who has fallen, is confused and cannot get up

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: A man suffers multiple injuries after a quad-bike accident on a farm near Penrith. Reported anaphylaxis following a bee sting has the heli-medics racing to the aid of Melody. Plus, cyclist Vivienne is in a bad way after her bike leaves the road on the notoriously steep Wrynose Pass in Cumbria

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz as Richard Ayoade and Sara Pascoe take on Jon Richardson and Chris McCausland. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate, aided by Morgana Robinson in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The staff have a mystery to unravel when an unknown patient arrives after collapsing in the street. The team eventually manage to contact his daughters as they try to find out what may have caused him to fall unconscious. Meanwhile, a 29-year-old man comes in following an accident at the gym, and a three-year-old girl is in paediatrics with her mum showing signs of a chest infection

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty determines whether brioche is bread or cake and why it has become the preferred choice for burgers, and Matt Tebbutt is on a mission to find out why wine comes in bottles of so many different shapes and sizes. Kate Quilton gets to the bottom of why some ice-creams melt faster than others

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty visits Mauritius to find out about white and dark rum and learns where the term 'proof' originally came from in relation to alcohol

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mal and Sue from Suffolk fell in love with Spain over 15 years ago and now want to retire there. After dedicating most of their lives to raising their large family, now is the time for their next chapter together in the sunshine. With their budget of £70,000 Danni Menzies shows them five properties around Vera

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Artisan brewers bottle their first beer in France, a restaurateur from Skegness, Lincolnshire, has his launch party shut down by the Portuguese police and a family from London renovate a French chateau

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Wales, where Henry restores a Royal Enfield motorbike, converting it into a classic cafe racer. Simon's choice of an old school house radiator springs a leak, but he gets an 1980s pinball machine back to its best

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien search for more items to fix up and sell on, visiting Windsor to meet Pete and Phil, who rent out cars to the film and TV business. Henry finds an Austrian moped which is missing an engine, while Simon picks a fibreglass suit of armour

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A member of the team celebrates retirement, while research into the estate of a Scottish woman reveals two generations of coachmen who worked during the dawn of the motoring age. Plus, details of unclaimed estates for which heirs still need to be found

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers look for the heirs of a newly advertised estate, and learn that a family member once made lace for Queen Victoria. Plus, two sisters embark on a journey of discovery when it is revealed they are descendants of someone they never knew existed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Grove Barn B&B in Denton, Norfolk, where owners Steph and Alan Flight hope that their approach to cleanliness will lead to good feedback from their guests. However, visitors Scott and Alistair make a discovery in the bathroom that leaves them with a sinking feeling. And there's confusion in the kitchen at breakfast time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second episode comes from Picaroons in Sheringham, Norfolk, where problems with the plumbing and a disastrous breakfast lead to harsh words between the hosts and their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at Brightham House in Malborough, Devon, where couple Scott Browning and Alastair Veness hope to impress their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at Moran's B&B in Westward Ho!, Devon, owned by ultra-chic retirees John and Jaqueline, although the lack of an en-suite does not impress Christine and Ian

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out how much they've been paid and to settle some scores. Grove Barn owners Steph and Alan have some hair-raising issues up for discussion after the cleaning critique they received

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: In south Wales, siblings Toni and Andrea are first to host, aiming to provide an authentic Italian experience for their rivals, who in turn serve up Spanish food and posh pub grub. Second to host are Dan and Rhys from La Cocina Tapas, who hope to see off the competition with their fresh Spanish servings

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: New chateau owners Jayne and Steve need to get four en suite themed bedrooms ready for their new B&B business. For the Oriental suite, Jayne goes to visit Angel for help and advice. Plus, a chance to meet Brit Justin and his Aussie wife Annabelle, who are turning their chateau, with its sweeping views of the Pyrenees, into a family home

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud returns to Somerset to see Ed and Vicky Versluys and their cowshed conversion. A year after his last visit and with the house finally complete, Kevin finds out what it's like living in an off-grid home designed for animals

programme.title: Matt Baker's Travels in the Country: USA
programme.desc: Matt arrives in the deserts of the southwest. In the Mojave Desert he explores Joshua Tree National Park where he helps the team saving the iconic Joshua Trees. He meets an artist who is drawn to the landscape and lends a hand to the rangers closing an old, abandoned gold mine. In Arizona, Matt learns how desert crop-growing relies on the Colorado river

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Documentary featuring real-life footage - from the funny to the dramatic - showing what can go wrong both on and off the train tracks. From shocking near-misses and devastating derailments to rush-hour rage and unique on-board entertainment, all captured on cameras and phones and told by the people who witnessed and survived them. Plus, psychologists and industry experts discuss train-related anxieties and situations that passengers could experience in and around the railways

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Marie, 31, arrives at St George's A&E in south-west London by ambulance after collapsing at home with an unexplained headache. Doctors work fast to ascertain the cause of her collapse, with potentially devastating results. Marie's joined by her partner Cameron and her young child. Cameras also follow Eileen, 87, who comes in with shortness of breath and a high heart rate, and 10-month-old Erin, who has a build-up of wax in her ears following a cold and fever

programme.title: Food Unwrapped

Plus, Matt Tebbutt heads to one of the UK's largest chocolate factories to find out what makes white chocolate white and gets the inside story on After Eights - learning how the minty fondant in the middle remains gooey

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Kate Quilton visits the world's largest jelly bean producers to discover what they are made of instead of gelatine, and Matt Tebbutt finds out why maple syrup is so expensive

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Alison from Scotland is hunting for a holiday home in Spain with her daughter, Paula, wanting the perfect place that feels 'traditionally Spanish'. Jasmine Harman is on hand to show them five properties around Vélez-Málaga for their budget of £60,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: There's chaos at a B&B in France when a pipe bursts during check in. A restaurateur in Portugal runs out of cutlery, a family of brewers from Kent launch their beer at a prestigious market, while at a B&B in Italy, the guests cannot find the bidet

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Max McMurdo head for Crewe to meet rock 'n' roller Billy, who lives in a house that is frozen in time in the 1950s

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Maidenhead, Berkshire, Simon O'Brien falls in love with an old ship's carpenter's chest, while Henry Cole takes away a miniature tether car, which he hopes to get moving again

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate officers work on the case of a £1.3million estate belonging to a retired policeman and share the story of an investigation that took them to Ireland. Plus, the team reveals more details of unclaimed assets

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers look for the relatives of a woman who died without leaving a will, and discover that her husband was a Second World War meteorologist. Plus, how an heir hunt that went all the way to Australia reveals the story of mass emigration thanks to the 'ten pound pom' campaign

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Shelley Guest House in Aberystwyth, where its husband-and-wife owners hope to prove that their establishment offers the best value for money by providing their guests with an old-school form of entertainment, some Spanish cuisine and a monumental continental breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests travel to the five-star Ixworth House in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, where hosts John and Sharyn Snell are quietly confident their establishment will impress. John reveals his hidden talents at dinner, but his performance at breakfast the next morning does not go down well with all of the fellow B&B owners

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In York, part-time panto dame Graham Smith runs the Georgian House & Mews, and takes his guests back in time with a Nordic test of strength. At supper, Hazel has romance on her mind, but the guests are left to fend for themselves at breakfast - until Graham makes a show-stopping appearance

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the George Hotel in Orton, Cumbria, for the fourth visit of the day. Owner Hazel McAleese organises a fishing trip as the afternoon activity, during which one of the guests decides to use the opportunity to give everyone a lesson in innuendo

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured throughout the contest reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: First to host in east London are chef-owner Nina and front of house Chloe of Jellyfish, where they hope that their Lebanese-inspired street food served in one of the area's most popular live music pubs will impress their guests. Second hosts, football mad chef Victor and restaurant owner Ben, of local Italian Bombetta, let the ingredients do the talking with their simple Italian food cooked with love - but with a real Italian coming to visit, will it be enough to impress? Meat-loving Brazilian chef Eduardo and his Italian front of house sidekick Valentina host the final night at their steakhouse, Omnino

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Dick visits Stephanie to help get the original chateau pizza oven working, but only after her mother has squeezed in to clear it out. Annabelle and Justin return from holiday to find their chateau infested with bees. They also knock through a fireplace in a master bedroom. Jayne and Steve finish the Nature Room. It's the first of their en suites to be completed, but whether their daughter and her fiancé will think it's good enough for their fledgling B&B business remains to be seen

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud returns to Devon to meet Kevin McCabe, a man who wanted to build one of the biggest houses the programme has ever seen. Finally, seven years after it began, the herculean task of building this giant cob castle is complete. Has it proven to be the great home he originally intended, and does it prove as he hoped that cob is a viable material for contemporary architecture?

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: George meets Peter and Julia, who had run their local Post Office and lived in the building above it for the last 20 years. Despite being forced to close the doors to the business, they felt such a connection with the building that they couldn't bear to sell it. But as soon as work began on the conversion, they discovered a crumbling wreck, falling apart at the seams

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: This edition focuses on how South Yorkshire police tackle the issues of sexual offences, with officers called to a suspected sexual assault outside a nightclub, while in another early-morning incident, officers confront a man after he exposes himself in the street. Call handlers deal with a case of sexual assault on a teen by other teenagers, and a man is arrested on suspicion of domestic rape as a result of a call from his wife

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cyclist Stephen, who's 48, has severely damaged his ankle after coming off his bike deep in woodland in Surrey, and doctors treat a man rushed in after collapsing with a suspected stroke in his garden. programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: Food Unwrapped Investigates

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: People forced out of their homes in Honduras by the notorious MS-13 gang plead their case for asylum in America. Officers discover 3,000lb of marijuana hidden in a cargo truck

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. New South Wales police are summoned to an assault in a bakery, and Victoria police execute a search warrant on a house suspected of growing marijuana.

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Western Australia police search three properties reportedly housing squatters, and Northern Territories officers conduct a rural roadside operation.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Dan gambles on a lot he might later regret in when the gang visits Milton Keynes, while Nat lets her heart rule her head on a sale

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits Tintagel, Cornwall's most mythical place, which was an important trading port with Europe and the birthplace of perhaps Britain's greatest legend - the tale of King Arthur. He also learns how the Methodists were important to Cornwall, and how they would cook a rather unusual bun during feast days, and meets a family on the Roseland Peninsula who are continuing the surprisingly ancient tradition of growing an exotic spice - saffron

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the rich and diverse history of West Penwith, the farthest point west in mainland Britain. He visits Lamorna Cove, made famous through song and art, and the Unesco-protected tin and copper mining area of Botallack, where he talks to a mining explorer. The chef also follows an ancient track in search of Cornwall's oldest building and reveals how, as a young lad on the Lizard Peninsula, he fell in love for the first time and tasted his first French fish stew - known as a bouillabaisse

programme.desc: Engineer Ralph Hosier leads two teams of car buffs in an engineering contest against pro-driver Shane Lynch's supercar. programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A refugee from war-torn Venezuela tells officers how she paid human traffickers to smuggle her through Central America and to the Mexico-United States border. In Laredo, an American couple caught smuggling methamphetamine inside cans of vegetables crumble while being questioned and give officers information about a chain of so-called 'stash houses' where drugs and illegal immigrants are being kept

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. New South Wales police dismantle a large drug syndicate, engage in a high-speed pursuit, and search for a offender who needs to be returned to prison.

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. New South Wales police search for drug-carrying vehicles, and Western Australia police hunt for a man who is suspected of turning dust into gold.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders head to Blackpool Pleasure Beach, where Nat and John gamble on a mode of transport, and an unpopular bargain hunter returns to the group

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: In Oxford, John goes against his wife's advice and ends up in a conflict with Dan, while Linda thinks she has spotted something the other bidders are yet to see, and George and Rupert take a risk on mysterious items hidden under dust sheets. Presented by Sean Kelly

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his gastronomic road trip from Venice to Istanbul taking in the countries of the former Byzantine Empire - a renowned melting pot of East and West. This instalment finds the gastronome in the city of Ravenna, where he discovers Piadinas, a thin Italian flatbread street food dating back to Roman times. He then crosses the Adriatic Sea to Croatia - a first for Rick - and a gets a chance to discover new a wealth of dishes such as pasticada, goat stew with peas and lamb peka

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Dave has a BMW X5 armed response vehicle build to oversee, and is also tasked with repairing a car damaged during a high-speed chase

programme.title: Fast Justice
programme.desc: The Sentinels lay a trap for a luxury car carrying a high value target and a couple claiming they were having brunch might be hiding something

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May put three supercars through their paces in Italy. Their weapons of choice are the 691bhp Lamborghini Aventador, McLaren's hi-tech MP4-12C, and a British brute in the form of the Noble M600. The journey begins at Nardo, a high-speed testing ground so vast it can be seen from space, and includes a nerve-racking drive in Rome before reaching its conclusion with a timed challenge against the Stig at the Imola circuit

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May travel to Beijing to learn about China's car industry, which has seen great expansion in recent years - but also have a violent encounter with one of the Stig's cousins. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond immerses himself in the world of Nascar at a race in Texas, and the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG Roadster is wrestled around the test track, emitting serious amounts of noise and smoke in the process. Future host Matt LeBlanc is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Driving Wars
programme.desc: Two teams of bikers go head to head in challenges using remotely operated cars. Colin Murray hosts

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: In the Jebel Akhdar mountain range of Oman, Steve leads an expedition into an unexplored desert canyon. With temperatures soaring, dehydration and heat stroke are a constant threat

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Rhod Gilbert force-feeds Alex Horne a jug of mocha, Kerry Godliman hits a cricket ball with a croquet mallet, and Phil Wang makes a really strange noise

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Actress Chizzy Akudolu, writer and actor Charlie Higson, historian Kate Williams and comedian Tom Allen take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets out from Birmingham on the first leg of a trip to Dartmoor, and a visit to the city's town hall reveals a magnificent organ and the location for a celebrated music festival. Travelling south to Kidderminster, he works in a Royal Mail sorting office and discovers more about great postal innovator Rowland Hill, before he ending his journey in Worcester, where he learns about the origins of the British Medical Association

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Redditch to Gloucester, beginning with a look back to Victorian times at a needle manufactory. He also learns how to make Gloucester cheese and joins the Gloucester Choral Society in a rendition of Jerusalem

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The next part of Michael Portillo's journey from Southampton to Wolverhampton begins in Wokingham, Berkshire, where the former politician finds out how demand from a growing number of rail commuters fuelled the development of the modern printing press. He then learns about a Tudor businessman who manufactured cloth in enormous volumes in Newbury, and ends this leg of his trip in Bradford on Avon, Wiltshire. Here, a local manufacturer describes how his Victorian forebears were the first in Britain to be licensed to vulcanise rubber

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the next stage of his journey to Wolverhampton, Michael Portillo visits Lacock Abbey near Chippenham in Wiltshire to find out how the world's first photographic negative was made. He then heads to Bristol Zoo, examines an extraordinary piece of Victorian engineering at Severn Tunnel Junction and ends the leg in Gloucester, where he meets a stonemason at the city's cathedral

programme.desc: Michael Portillo journeys from Stroud to Bath, investigating the Victorian origins of snooker, before ploughing a crooked furrow at the Royal Agricultural College in Cirencester. At his final destination in Bath, he takes tea with the ladies, and also discovers a scandalous novel written by an eccentric recluse, who was once the wealthiest man in England

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Bristol to Glastonbury, entering the foul-smelling world of a Victorian tannery and hearing how a 19th-century entrepreneur made his fortune thanks to mountains of bird droppings, using his wealth to build churches and one of the most luxurious country houses in Britain. When he reaches his destination, Michael heads for the mystical Glastonbury Abbey, where Victorian tourists flocked to hear tales of King Arthur and the Holy Grail

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the final leg of his journey from Southampton to the West Midlands, Michael Portillo visits the spa town of Cheltenham, where he gets behind the wheel of a very early locomotive carriage that ran on the road. In Tewkesbury, he joins a group re-enacting a battle from the Wars of the Roses, before he reaches his final destination of Wolverhampton, where he hears how Queen Victoria made an emotional visit that signalled the end of her exile from public life after mourning Prince Albert

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a journey to Chichester, with the first leg beginning in Norwich. At the city's Norman castle he uncovers the Victorian public's gory fascination with crime and punishment and finds out how campaigners such as Elizabeth Fry worked to improve conditions for prisoners. Heading west to Thetford, he explores how the Victorian appetite for rabbits and their fur led to special train services to London, and ends in the Suffolk town of Brandon, where he tries his hand at flint-knapping

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Ipswich to Chelmsford, starting at an agricultural implements works with its own railway sidings. His final destination is Chelmsford, home to the world's first purpose-built radio equipment factory, established by Guglielmo Marconi

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the next leg of his journey, Michael Portillo heads along the Essex bank of the Thames before crossing the river into Kent. He begins in Barkingside, where Victorian philanthropist Thomas Barnardo made it his mission to transform the lives of destitute children. The former politician then tries his hand at loading a container onto a pocket wagon at Tilbury docks, and ends his trip in Rochester, where he encounters a host of familiar characters and explores a town that was an inspiration for many of Charles Dickens' works

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-three Donna Harris hosts the second dinner party in Northampton, and hopes that three courses of pure comfort-food will be enough to secure the £1,000 prize. Donna spends almost as much time fixing her make-up as she does preparing the meal, and when guests Duncan Fielding and Caroline Nash discover a secret stash of football shirts, they realise there is more to their hostess than meets the eye

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Part-time actress Caroline Nash is the host on day three of the competition in Northampton, and she hopes that a menu based on her travels will dazzle her guests. However, the night gets off to a shaky start as Donna Harris finds a hair on the side of her goat's cheese salad, while businessman Duncan Fielding seems more interested in goats themselves than the food

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Party-loving Barb Wiles hosts the fourth dinner party in the Northampton area, and hopes her Australian-themed menu will wow her guests and win her the £1,000 prize. However, the competitors are unnerved by her interest in extraterrestrials while snooping around her bedroom, and things go from bad to worse when a seafood starter and undercooked chicken result in tears at the dinner table

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Attention-loving businessman and keen cricketer Duncan Fielding takes centre stage in hosting the final dinner party from Northampton. He creates a menu based on the story of his life - which is full of surprises and full of spice - but it proves a challenge for three of his guests, who like their food mild. His main feature is a chicken and reindeer curry, and the table is impressed to discover that he runs a community pub from the bottom of his garden

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman travels to Peyia in western Cyprus to help Pauline and Chris find their perfect holiday home on a budget of £80,000

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: The charity version of the popular baking show returns, and with Noel Fielding on paternity leave, Matt Lucas is presenting on his own. In previous editions, comedian Tom Allen has stepped in to co-present - but today he is showing off his baking skills as one of the contestants, alongside Star Wars actress Daisy Ridley, comedian Rob Beckett and singer Alexandra Burke. To impress Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith, the celebrities serve up millionaire shortbread, a fruity tart and their pet hates in cake form in the showstopper

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country
programme.desc: Sarah and Graham turn their attention to the family room and how best to use the empty space downstairs. They draw inspiration from the Chinese bedroom at Longleat House and the plant-based textiles and natural dyes on display at London Fashion Week. Sarah realises that she can't carry on working in random parts of the house, so comes up with a plan to seamlessly weave her workspace into the living area.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: A nutrition student hoping to meet a man who is open with his feelings finds she is not used to compliments during a date with a football coach, and has to brush up on her flirting. Elsewhere, two diners bond over their shared love of dogs, a farmer presents his date with a gift of beetroot, and a woman discovers she has met her supposedly blind date before

programme.title: Mr & Mrs Smith (2005)
programme.desc: An outwardly bored suburban couple lead double lives as professional assassins, both unaware of their partner's secret. When they are hired to kill each other, the deadly situation puts some much-needed excitement back into their stale relationship. Comedy adventure, starring Brad Pitt, Angelina Jolie, Vince Vaughn and Adam Brody

programme.title: Celebrity Hunted
programme.desc: With just 48 hours till extraction, Saffron and Bobby take a risk and go solo. Nik and Eva continue to taunt the hunters with a postcard from the Welsh coast but their route to the extraction point is nerve-wracking. Hunter HQ use every trick they have in the final push to catch the celebrities before they are extracted and tensions rise with close calls, a motorway pursuit and a desperate foot race as the competition comes to an adrenaline-fuelled end

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back at two shows highlighting the way working from home is changing the way many people live. Northampton newlyweds Nikki and Andy both worked from home but their cluttered terrace was close to bursting point. Meanwhile, Amber ran her own fitness classes from her home and wanted somewhere brighter and bigger for her clients. Could Kirstie persuade them to go with her redesigns or would Phil find either couple a much more suitable new place?

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents as 22-year-old Ukrainian refugee Mariia enters the studio. Since fleeing the war, the pansexual sex therapist has settled in the UK and is now looking for love with a far-from-average man or woman who can keep up with her in the bedroom. She is followed by 24-year-old Alannah, a content creator from Bristol, who is seeking a forever bloke who can speak the language of love and feels comfortable in his body

programme.title: Send Nudes: Body SOS
programme.desc: Hairdresser Alex wants more muscle and young mum Elle wants to be rid of her stretch marks. Will their life-size post-surgery avatars help make up their minds?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Occupational nurse Christine hosts the third dinner party in Llanelli, where she tries to impress her guests with a menu of family favourites and a performance by her number one rock band. programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

Night two sees Kenny and Kenny, a married couple whose love of Mexico sees them trying to replicate authentic local food from their beloved country. programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman meets Peter and Karen Williams from Shropshire, who fell in love with Portugal's eastern Algarve 12 years ago and now want to relocate there permanently. Jasmine finds them five homes suited to their £150,000 budget, including a property reduced by £50,000, and a house that feels just like their place back in the UK

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Keen walkers Rosie and Michael Mulroy from Durham are looking for a holiday home from which they can explore the stunning Andalusian hills and countryside around Frigiliana in southern Spain. Jasmine Harman shows them five properties for their £120,000 budget, from town centre apartments to quaint village townhouses, but will any of them appeal to both heart and head?

The guests she must impress are 32-year-old entertainer David, 69-year-old Norwegian plain-talker Vivi, 47-year-old super-competitive Neil and 25-year-old media sales worker Charlotte. With risky menu choices and a fellow diner's peculiar laughter taking the spotlight, will the conversations ranging from lookalikes to riding polar bears be enough to secure Shanice the prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired estate agent Vivi hosts the second dinner party in and around Guildford. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The penultimate day in and around Guildford, Surrey, sees children's entertainments manager David playing host. Having worked in the entertainments industry all his life, he is no stranger to showing people a good time, and employs his colleagues to put on a performance, while keeping his food simple. Is he forgetting the key ingredients of a dinner party?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final day in and around Guildford, Surrey, sales director Neil devises a sophisticated menu, dismissing his predecessors' efforts as unambitious. Jamie needs to transport himself, his team of almost 40 and over 100,000 stems of the best flowers available everywhere by boat, in baking heat. programme.title: Frankie Boyle's Farewell to the Monarchy
programme.desc: The comedian takes a look back at the darker side of the royal family's 1000-year history, and wonders how generations of land-grabbing, child-murdering, wife-beheading, slave-trading, misogyny, violence and empire-building have shaped our royal family today. Frankie looks back to the reigns of six key monarchs who not only had huge influence in their day, but still live long in our collective memory - and finds troubling connections between their grim past and the present

programme.title: The Windsors
programme.desc: Comedy soap opera from the writers of Star Stories that imagines the royal family as they have never been seen before

programme.title: Taskmaster

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: A nutrition student hoping to meet a man who is open with his feelings finds she is not used to compliments during a date with a football coach, and has to brush up on her flirting. programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa tries to make amends for cheating in an exam, but the school authorities have a vested interest in high grades and turn a deaf ear to her confession that she bought the answers from Nelson. Meanwhile, Homer adopts a bizarre new pet - a lobster

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired French teacher Meic hosts the fourth night of the competition in Llanelli, Carmarthenshire, and plans an authentic French menu including poulet Basquaise. Fellow diner Charlotte makes an impression when she arrives wearing an onion necklace, and the host hopes that his specially branded cremes brulees will impress his guests

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three rival duos compete in Glasgow, where highlights include a bit of karaoke, a game of guess that tune and one menu inspired by moments in the couple's relationship

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton offers advice to Liverpool couple John and Wendy Houghton, who have been married for 43 years and have long dreamt of owning a holiday home around the Spanish coastal town of Torrevieja on the Costa Blanca. The property expert leaves no stone unturned in showing the pair how far their budget of £50,000 will stretch, with the couple viewing a two-bedroom apartment with scenic vistas and a ground-floor apartment located by a picture-perfect square

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Retired couple Roger and Obie Pearce want a slice of the Spanish good life. Obie has never been to Spain before, and Roger hasn't visited since he was in the army 40 years ago, but they are determined to relocate to Almeria where Roger's health could benefit from the warm climate. Ben Hillman sets out to find them their perfect home on a budget of £120,000

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: In Almería, mother-and-son duo Sharon and Shaun catch up with love birds Janice and Bill who, when their property search began, had only been together six months. programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.desc: First aid manager Jacqui hosts the first dinner party in Perth, where she plans to impress her guests, optometric consultant Daniel, cabinet-maker Craig, administrator Lorea and procurement officer Jenna with her hearty cuisine, including a sticky toffee pudding

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Aspiring actor Daniel hosts the second dinner party in Perth, and hopes to impress his fellow contestants with a twist on the traditional Scottish menu - serving spaghetti hagginaise for his main and soft-drink flavoured ice-cream for dessert. But with outspoken guest Jenna admitting her dislike for the host, the attention is diverted away from the food

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

Initial inquiries focus on a petty officer with a history of drug use who may have wanted the doctor to remain silent about his problems. American drama, starring David McCallum

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team are called in when a Navy reservist returns home to find her husband missing and her living room covered in blood, and make a grim discovery when they find a finger in the bin. Meanwhile, Ziva ruffles a few feathers by insisting on continuing her investigation into the murder of her father, asking for permission to go to Rome on the trail of the chief suspect. Mark Harmon stars

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A female cop is found stabbed to death in a park alongside a Hispanic male with a near-fatal gunshot wound. Further investigations lead Briscoe and Curtis to a girl who suffered a tough childhood in the care of an abusive father and drug-addicted mother, and her alibi appears to be flimsy at best. Robert Vaughn guest stars

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A newly appointed judge is knocked over and killed while trying to escape from the tabloid journalist who has been harassing her. The team is all set to press charges against the reporter, but it soon becomes clear there is more to the case than meets the eye. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Steven Hill

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The officers discover a girl's body in a hospital emergency room, and the subsequent investigation leads to the revelation that she was killed during an unauthorised exorcism carried out by an overzealous nun who claims her behaviour was directed by the voice of an angel. Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The investigation into a fatal attack on a semi-retired divorce lawyer by a disgruntled client reveals a network of bribery and corrupt medical practices. As the team unravels the tangled threads of the case, it appears a trio of doctors may be destined for prosecution - and it is not long before a further murder occurs. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Police officer Danny Pelham is murdered while staking out the apartment of a wanted man's girlfriend. The felon he was trying to snare becomes the chief suspect, and Briscoe and Curtis eventually track him down, only to discover the murdered cop had a history of violence against his girlfriend. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An internal security breach forces NCIS to go into lockdown when a covert listening device is found in a pen belonging to Secretary of the Navy Sarah Porter. DiNozzo discovers that National Security Agency analyst Ellie Bishop wrote a report two years previously predicting the possibility of such an occurrence and she is brought in to assist with the investigation and track down the culprit. Guest starring Leslie Hope and Emily Wickersham

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team is called in to investigate when marine corporal Flegman is found shot to death, and a phone leads them to a hotel room where Gibbs awkwardly stumbles upon his ex-wife Diane Sterling and her FBI agent ex-husband TC Fornell. She had been attempting to call her boyfriend Eddie to break up with him, but somehow Flegman had taken possession of his phone. The team tracks down Eddie's car and discovers a clown nose along with traces of blood and he quickly becomes the prime suspect

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates when a mysterious, fast-spreading illness strikes children from military families. While Gibbs tries to determine the cause, Abby and Jimmy partner with the Naval Medical Research Centre in the hope of delivering a cure before the holidays. Mark Harmon stars

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A woman learning about her birth parents asks for help. Carisi and Rollins weigh the risks of taking their relationship public

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Nichols investigates when a drug dealer is killed by a man who beat her to death after she refused to kiss him. He is intrigued by the fact that her body had been scrubbed with bleach, and when the case has him stumped he takes the little evidence they have to a forensic scientist he greatly admires in the hope he can break the case. Crime drama, guest starring Dylan Baker (Spider-Man 2), with Jeff Goldblum

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Munch investigates the rape and beating of a mute girl who can only communicate by drawing pictures. The case becomes more complicated with the realisation that a sketch of her attacker resembles a local priest, who may have antagonised some of his parishioners because of his controversial practices. Crime drama, starring Richard Belzer

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler and Tutuola link an artist's death to a similar murder, but another detective is assigned to the case and does all he can to exclude them from the investigation. Suspecting a serial killer is on the loose, they continue their inquiries - and find out the victims could be linked to a courier company because they all lost baggage on recent holidays. Crime drama, guest starring Delroy Lindo

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A woman claims to have been raped by a stranger to hide the fact she is a victim of domestic abuse, but later admits that her husband has been beating her because she does not want children with him. While conducting inquiries, Benson stumbles on a shockingly similar case involving the victim's elderly neighbour. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Rossi returns to the 30-year-old case of a serial killer who tortured and killed dozens of women in a Virginia suburb. A spate of similar crimes makes the locals fear a copycat is at large, but the detective discovers the original perpetrator has teamed up with his son to relive his last murder. Guest starring David Rees Snell (The Shield)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU team travels to Ohio to identify a serial killer who is murdering married couples in Akron. Meanwhile, Hotchner looks to the agents to fill a recent vacancy in the team

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: New Mossad director Orli Elbaz asks for the team's help in finding Ilan Bodnar when one of her agents is shot dead in Virginia, telling Gibbs he was investigating several operatives who had gone rogue after Eli David's death. Ziva travels with Tony to Berlin in her pursuit of Bodnar, the man she believes was responsible for the death of her father. Guest starring Marina Sirtis (Star Trek: The Next Generation)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tracks Bodnar's SUV to a remote house in the countryside, but inside find only his dead accomplice - identified as a South African mercenary who helped Bodnar procure diamonds. Ziva and Tony, meanwhile, discharge themselves from hospital and wheedle information out of Abby to continue investigating on the quiet, having been warned by Homeland Security to stay off the case

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A cook from a US Navy destroyer tells McGee and Gibbs he believes someone is stalking him with the intention of trying to make him poison the crew, and a picture on a stolen phone leads the team to a group testing the psychological effects of surveillance. Meanwhile, Richard Parsons from the Inspector General's office closes in on Ziva as he investigates the death of Ilan Bodnar, the man who killed her father. Guest starring Colin Hanks

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Paramedics become suspicious about a baby's death, calling in Briscoe and Curtis, who discover the parents adopted the child from an illegal Russian ring. The case takes on another dimension altogether when it transpires that the crooks specialise in placing terminally ill infants with unsuspecting families. Starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: McCoy and Carmichael have the unenviable task of prosecuting three police officers with a racially motivated hate crime that threatens to cause uproar in the city. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Angie Harmon

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A narcotics detective plans a major drugs sting but makes the mistake of illegally using a teenager as bait - with fatal consequences. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The team investigates when a respected journalist is shot shortly after writing a hard-hitting article on the New York drugs scene. It soon emerges that the story was fabricated and had earned the reporter his fair share of enemies, while an unexpected lead causes the officers to reopen a 20-year-old case concerning the murder of a famous actress. Jerry Orbach and Steven Hill star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the case of a college professor pushed under a subway train - and the subsequent investigation leads to a man who had kidnapped his children and changed his identity 15 years earlier. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A respected financial analyst dies from an overdose of Viagra, a drug he was advised not to take. The subsequent investigation uncovers foul play involving his mistress (guest star Julia Roberts) and an unscrupulous tycoon, whose attorneys thwart McCoy and Carmichael's attempts to prosecute. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A petty officer is killed by a stolen surveillance drone and the team links it to elusive terrorist Benham Parsa. NCIS joins forces with the Department of Defence to track down the device before it is used for a large-scale attack, but Gibbs is less than pleased that he has to work with his ex-lover Hollis Mann. Meanwhile, McGee hopes he will be granted time off to attend a black-tie gala honouring his girlfriend Delilah. Guest starring Susanna Thompson (Arrow)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: In an effort to find the terrorist Parsa, Gibbs and the NCIS team track down one of his cohorts using evidence gleaned from the drone attack which has killed six people and wounded a further 22. Meanwhile, an emotionally shaken McGee struggles with the ramifications of the incident. Drama, starring Mark Harmon, Sean Murray, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The murder of a port authority officer reveals Parsa's possible whereabouts as the team continues the hunt for the terrorist intent on wiping out NCIS. Bishop reveals her past association with the quarry and suggests where she thinks he may be found, but the CIA has intercepted a call that places Parsa in a different location to Ellie's hunch. Mark Harmon and Emily Wickersham star

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team is questioned by a senate committee about its retaliation to Prentiss's disappearance and assumed death, but a familiar face could offer hope. Crime drama, starring Joe Mantegna and Thomas Gibson

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A woman reports her granddaughter has disappeared, triggering an investigation that leaves Benson and Stabler suspecting the missing girl's irresponsible mother may have abducted her. Unfortunately, the truth proves far less straightforward - and the case ends tragically. Crime drama, guest starring Hilary Duff, with Mariska Hargitay and Christopher Meloni

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A teenage girl is hurt in a fall, but doctors discover she is also suffering from injuries sustained in an attack, setting Benson and Stabler off on a search for her assailant. They soon learn she is a kickboxer, which sheds light on the situation - but the case takes a sinister turn with the discovery that she sent erotic photos of herself to fellow pupils. Drama, guest starring Ezra Miller (We Need to Talk About Kevin), with Mariska Hargitay, Christopher Meloni and Dann Florek

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The death of a marine who became pregnant after being raped on active service in Iraq brings the unit into conflict with the Pentagon. She is found to have been killed by a method taught to elite troops and Greylek has to fight the military to retain jurisdiction of the case, while Benson's flashbacks of her own sexual assault may be clouding her judgement. Starring Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A woman is left beaten and raped with no memory of what happened, putting Benson and Stabler on the trail of a serial offender who uses drugs to control women. They manage to locate the culprit, but the subsequent prosecution is hampered by a previous victim's refusal to testify and the case comes dangerously close to falling apart. Drama, guest starring Michael Trucco (Battlestar Galactica)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU team tries to catch a serial killer targeting families throughout the Midwest. Meanwhile, Morgan worries when Ellie runs away from her foster family and pays him a visit

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU team searches for a killer who has struck Detroit for the past three years during the pre-Halloween celebration called Devil's Night

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates when Navy Seal Chad McBride's wife receives a package from Riyadh in Saudi Arabia containing her husband's severed head, which Palmer discovers contains very high levels of radiation. McBride's commanding officer reveals the soldier was on a top-secret reconnaissance mission and asks Vance not to disclose the details to anyone. Meanwhile, Richard Parsons tries to get Gibbs to take responsibility for the many unnecessary deaths for which he holds the NCIS team accountable

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The American crime drama returns with the team still reeling from the Department of Defence investigation, with Ziva, McGee and Tony having handed in their badges. Parsons continues his inquiries into Gibbs and his agents, but events take a turn when an explosion kills the Secretary of the US Navy and seriously injures the director of Homeland Security. When attempts are made on the lives of Gibbs and Tony, it appears that all of the NCIS agents are in mortal danger. Starring Mark Harmon and Colin Hanks

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Sarah Porter, the new Secretary of the Navy, charges Gibbs and the team with finding terrorist group the Brotherhood of Doubt, which was responsible for killing her predecessor. She expects the group's next target to be billionaire Tomas Mendez, who spends his money trying to defeat terrorism, but whose motives may not be entirely altruistic. Meanwhile, Tony flies to Tel Aviv, where new Mossad director Orli Elbaz reveals they have a report of a possible sighting of Ziva at a kibbutz she went to as a child. Crime drama, guest starring Marina Sirtis

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Curtis and Briscoe investigate after a child in day care is injected with a fatal disease. They uncover a medical scandal of frightening proportions, and the child's own father comes under suspicion. Award-winning police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate the murder of a doctor at a fertility clinic, but are embroiled in a dispute between two women over the ownership of frozen embryos. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The execution-style murder of a prison guard triggers an examination of the corruption apparently inherent in the state's penal system. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Angie Harmon

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the discovery of a prostitute's body behind a rubbish bin. As inquiries get under way, they uncover a seedy case involving the shipping of illegal immigrants, police corruption and virtual sex

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A pregnant student is found murdered, and detectives Briscoe and Curtis discover she was strangled to death before being stabbed by the killer in an effort to make the attack seem like the random act of a psychopath. A mathematics professor soon comes under suspicion as eyewitnesses allege he was close to the crime scene on the night in question

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Part one of two. A shootout between a motorist and the police leads to the discovery of a body in a car boot - and puts the detectives on the trail of a money-laundering operation run by Russian gangsters. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team uncovers faulty bulletproof vests in an abandoned truck filled with stolen USMC merchandise, and attempts to locate the source of the cargo and any vests that could have been sent to military personnel overseas. Crime drama, guest starring Challen Cates, with Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: DiNozzo confronts a man impersonating a Navy officer, which results in guns being drawn, and the only eyewitness to the case is the Special Agent's father - who is in town to disclose a secret to his son. The 250th episode of the crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A bomb detonates at a military charity concert, killing two men. Called to investigate, Tony and McGee try to determine whether the intended target was the 1980s rocker headlining the act or if the attack was part of a larger scheme against the military. Meanwhile, Jimmy prepares for parenthood. Keith Carradine guest stars, with Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A gun is brought into the station as part of the NYPD's firearms amnesty, and Danny is convinced the man who handed it in is linked to a robbery. However, arresting him could undermine public faith in the programme, which is run on a 'no questions asked' basis - and the detective discovers the situation is not as clear-cut as he had thought

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A man accused of sexual assault is adamant that he contacted the woman on a fantasy rape website. Benson and Stabler reveal that the victim's computer may have been hacked, leading them to suspect her ex-boyfriend of setting her up - but during the trial, the judge asks the detectives to help solve a 30-year-old murder that could be connected to the case. Crime drama, guest starring Alan Dale

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A criminal performing community service is suspected of murdering a woman in Central Park, but flees before he can be questioned. The detectives track him down to a booby-trapped bunker and manage to apprehend him - but even after he is in custody, the killings continue. Crime drama, guest starring Nick Stahl, with Mariska Hargitay and Christopher Meloni

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives investigate when a woman appears on a family's doorstep claiming to be their daughter, who went missing four years ago. She says she had been abducted and kept as a sex slave, and although some details of her story do not check out Benson is sure she has been abused, and is determined to uncover the truth of the case. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay and Chris Meloni

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives try to identify a teenager's body found in the Hudson River. They discover she had recently been in Ukraine and assume she had been trafficked for sex, but when they press a pimp for information he reveals he never met the victim - she was actually a maths prodigy and US citizen who attended a school for gifted students. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay and Christopher Meloni

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team hunts for three college students who are abducting, raping and killing women before dumping their bodies in cornfields in rural Indiana. Two of the men are unaware their companion is actually murdering their victims and the BAU faces a race to stop them from committing another crime

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The body of a woman who has been missing for three days is discovered in a Georgetown alley, and although her murder does not seem to be linked to any other case, mutilations on the corpse prompt the DC police to call in the BAU team

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. programme.title: Kindred Spirits
programme.desc: Ghost hunters Amy Bruni and Adam Berry investigate the home of a former executioner who killed hundreds of criminals. It seems that something is trying to kill the current homeowner - but who or what?

programme.title: Ghost Adventures
programme.desc: Ghost hunters Zak Bagans, Nick Groff and Aaron Goodwin visit Hotel Metlen in Dillon, Montana. Built in 1897 the historic building has numerous stories of hauntings and strange activity. The third floor, closed to the public for 20 years, is where the strangest events have been heard and felt, and the crew gains access to this closed-off part of the building to find out if the tales are true

programme.desc: There's a 1970s theme prior to Natasha Raskin Sharp and Raj Bisram's last auction in Cambridge, as Raj weighs in with a large set of standing scales and Natasha shells out on a lazy Susan. programme.desc: Amanda Middleditch and Julie Tatchell work their magic on a threadbare teddy bear whose owner emigrated Down Under many years ago but was not permitted to take his best friend with him by Australian customs. programme.title: Carrington VC (1954)
programme.desc: A decorated Army major resorts to embezzling mess funds to make ends meet - an act that leaves him facing a court martial, with the evidence stacked against him. To make matters worse, his wife sees the opportunity to get revenge for his wartime affairs by providing false testimony for the prosecution. Courtroom drama, starring David Niven, Margaret Leighton, Noelle Middleton, Laurence Naismith and Clive Morton

programme.title: A Kiss Before Dying (1956)
programme.desc: A psychopathic college student is horrified to learn his girlfriend is pregnant, threatening his chances of being accepted into her well-to-do family. In a fit of fury, he murders her and makes it look as if she had committed suicide - only for her sister to show up, taking an uncomfortable degree of interest in the manner of her sibling's death. Thriller, with Robert Wagner, Joanne Woodward, Jeffrey Hunter and Mary Astor

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: William becomes convinced Mary is involved with Reuben, and arrives at her flat hoping to catch them red-handed - only to discover he has got it all wrong. Unable to cope with the subsequent embarrassment, he ends their relationship and considers selling his business and making a fresh start in New Zealand, but Mary hears of his plans and rushes round, shocking him with a marriage proposal. programme.title: EFL Cup Highlights
programme.desc: Manchester United v Tottenham Hotspur. Action from the 2009 final at Wembley Stadium, where the first major trophy of the season was contested. Spurs were the holders, having defeated Chelsea 2-1 after extra time in last year's final, while the Red Devils had last lifted the cup in 2006 following a comfortable 4-0 win against Wigan Athletic

programme.title: EFL Cup Retro
programme.desc: Manchester United v Tottenham Hotspur in the 2008/09 final. Spurs were managed by Harry Redknapp and had a strong run that led them to the final of the competition, having beaten the likes of Newcastle, Liverpool and Watford in previous rounds. The Red Devils had beaten Middlesbrough, Queens Park Rangers and Blackburn Rovers in the early rounds, before beating Derby County 4-3 on aggregate
